title: Login success with valid credentials
description: Verify that a user can successfully log in using valid username and password credentials.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Enter a valid username and password.
Click the login button.
Confirm that the login is successful and the user is redirected to the dashboard.

title: Login failure with invalid credentials
description: Ensure that login fails when the username or password is incorrect and appropriate error messages are shown.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Enter an invalid username or password.
Click the login button.
Verify that the user receives an error message indicating invalid credentials and no access is granted.

title: Login rate limiting and brute force protection
description: Validate that repeated failed login attempts trigger rate limiting to prevent brute force attacks.

steps.description: Attempt to login with invalid credentials repeatedly exceeding allowed attempts.
Check that the system blocks further login attempts temporarily and shows a rate limit warning.

title: Logout functionality
description: Verify that the user can log out successfully and the session is terminated.

steps.description: Login successfully to the application.
Click the logout button.
Confirm that the user is redirected to the login page and that the session is invalidated.

title: Create song with valid lyrics and chords input
description: Test that a user can create a song by inputting valid lyrics and chords and that the output is formatted correctly.

steps.description: Login and navigate to the song creation interface.
Input valid text containing lyrics with chord annotations.
Submit the song for processing.
Verify that the generated chord chart output is aligned, legible, and correctly formatted.

title: Create song with edge case input (complex chords and large text)
description: Ensure the system correctly processes and formats songs containing complex chord symbols and large volumes of lyrics.

steps.description: Enter a song with complex chords such as sus4, augmented, diminished, and slash chords.
Include a large amount of lyric text.
Submit the song for generation.
Confirm the chord chart is properly formatted and no truncation or misalignment occurs.

title: Transposition of chords upward by multiple semitones
description: Verify that transposition mechanism correctly shifts all chords up by specified number of semitones preserving chord quality and formatting.

steps.description: Open a created song with chords in original key.
Transpose chords upward by 3 semitones.
Check all chords have been shifted correctly and original formatting is preserved.

title: Transposition of chords downward including edge case with flats
description: Test shifting chords down including those with flat accidentals ensuring chord correctness and format remain accurate.

steps.description: Select a song containing chords with sharps and flats.
Transpose chords down by 2 semitones.
Verify chords correctly reflect the downward transposition including proper handling of accidentals.

title: Capo simulation adjustment of chords
description: Validate that selecting a capo position shifts the chord representation accordingly within the interface.

steps.description: Open a song and set capo position to 5th fret.
Verify chords displayed are properly adjusted to simulate capo at that position.

title: Capo simulation edge case at position zero and maximum fret
description: Ensure the capo system correctly handles edge cases such as no capo and highest supported fret without erroneous chord shifts.

steps.description: Set capo position to zero and verify no chord transposition occurs.
Set capo position to maximum supported fret (e.g. 12).
Confirm chords adjust correctly in both scenarios without format loss.

title: Create, edit, and delete setlists
description: Verify full lifecycle management of setlists including creation, editing (name and songs), and deletion.

steps.description: Create a new setlist with a unique name.
Edit the setlist to change its name.
Add multiple songs to the setlist.
Remove a song from the setlist.
Delete the setlist.
Validate each operation updates the interface and database accordingly with correct feedback.

title: Setlist song ordering functionality
description: Verify that songs within a setlist can be reordered and that the order persists upon saving and reloading.

steps.description: Open an existing setlist with multiple songs.
Change the order of songs using provided controls.
Save the setlist.
Refresh or reopen the setlist and confirm the new order is preserved.

title: Responsive layout adaptation for desktop, tablet, and mobile
description: Test the application UI adjusts correctly and remains functional across various viewport sizes and device types.

steps.description: Open the application in desktop resolution.
Verify the full layout with all menus and controls is visible and usable.
Resize viewport to tablet dimensions or emulate a tablet device.
Check layout adjusts, hamburger menu appears and touch gestures are active.
Resize or emulate mobile device viewport.
Confirm UI remains responsive, menus accessible, and gestures work appropriately.

title: Full screen mode functionality with scrolling controls
description: Ensure that full screen mode activates correctly and scrolling controls for presentation function as expected.

steps.description: Open a chord chart in presentation mode.
Activate full screen mode.
Validate full screen is engaged and chord chart is displayed without UI clutter.
Use scrolling or navigation controls to move through the chord chart.
Ensure smooth navigation and correct updates of displayed content.

title: Admin user creation, editing, deletion and password change
description: Verify that administrators can manage user accounts including creating new users, editing details, deleting users, and changing passwords securely.

steps.description: Login as an admin user.
Create a new user with valid data.
Confirm the new user appears in user list.
Edit the newly created user's details.
Verify changes are saved successfully.
Change the new user's password via the admin interface.
Ensure the password update is successful and the user can log in with the new password.
Delete the user.
Confirm the user is removed from the list and cannot access the system.

title: Security validation: password hashing and CSRF protection
description: Verify that passwords are stored hashed and that CSRF protection is active on all forms.

steps.description: Inspect the backend storage for user passwords.
Confirm password hashes are stored, and no plaintext passwords exist.
Attempt common CSRF vectors on forms like login, song creation, and setlist modification.
Verify CSRF tokens are required and requests without valid tokens are rejected.

title: CORS configuration and secure headers validation
description: Check that CORS policies are correctly set and security headers such as Content-Security-Policy and X-Frame-Options are present.

steps.description: Make cross-origin requests and inspect response headers.
Confirm CORS headers restrict requests properly and security headers are present in responses.

title: Offline capabilities and PWA functionality
description: Verify key application features are accessible offline and that PWA manifests and service workers function correctly.

steps.description: Load the application and then disconnect the network.
Check the application remains usable for viewing and editing cached songs and setlists.
Verify the PWA manifest is valid and that the app can be installed as a PWA.

title: Browser compatibility testing across Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, iOS, and Android
description: Ensure the application loads, displays, and functions correctly across modern browsers and operating systems including mobile platforms.

steps.description: Open the application on latest versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge browsers.
Verify UI rendering, feature availability, and interactions work consistently without errors.
Open the application on iOS and Android mobile devices.
Confirm responsive design, touch gestures, and offline capabilities behave as expected.

title: Print functionality and print optimization
description: Validate that users can print chord charts and setlists with output formatted suitably for paper, free of unnecessary UI elements.

steps.description: Open a chord chart or setlist.
Activate the print command from the interface.
Confirm the printed output is clear, legible, properly formatted, and excludes navigation or other UI controls.
